name: First Tracks Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a week long break in First tracks and in line with all the other reviews it was amazing.
reviews.title: Amazing

likes.liked: — the luxury of the apartment and proximity to slopes
likes.disliked: — nothing!!! and I'm a very difficult person to please in terms of hol accommodation

reviews.title: Ignore the last reviews criticims. This place is the Bomb
reviews.text: I booked first tracks on the basis of the trip advisor reviews and wasn't disapointed. We ended up with a 1.5 bedroom apt(+ den and shower room) due to some confusion with our booking (we originally booked for a 1 bedroom). The apartments are funished to a very high standard (granite work sufaces, underfloor heating, spa baths,silver kitchen appliances). They are very homely,comfortable and clean

reviews.title: The Good and the Bad
reviews.text: The location beside the gondola is perfect for the keen skiier, my husband was out by 8.15 every morning whilst I stayed in bed!

Almost the only tiny negative comment I have is that the locks on the ski lockers are quite complicated to work and in terms of the location the runs back down to Creekside are intermediate and hard going on tired legs.
reviews.title: Doesn't get any better!

reviews.text: Coming from the UK my only experience of skiing and ski accomodation is in the French Alps.
reviews.title: Great Place

likes.liked: — The fact that it was very modern and right next to the gondola

reviews.text: When I go skiing, I like to find a place right at the slopes, ski-in, ski-out, no time and effort wasted hauling all the ski gear around. First Tracks' location is perfect -- you are right at the base of the Creekside Gondola, with a ski storage room that is perhaps 30 seconds from the lift. Access to skiing was fabulous. In fact our 5th floor suite looked out over the Gondola, with a nice view up the slope and up the mountain.
reviews.title: Fabulous Place to Stay in Whistler

likes.disliked: — All that skiing wore me out -- sore legs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 10 nights here in a group that had 2 large suites -- one was 4 bedrooms, one was 3 bedrooms. The suites were large, upscale, very comfortable. The building overall is tasteful and has that whole natural wood and rock lodge vibe. Good kitchens, lots of room, big bathrooms, very cushy and comfortable. Very clean and quiet -- I never heard any noises coming through the walls. In room laundry, which is nice when you ski. Large ski storage rooms with 2 levels of security to protect your gear.
reviews.title: Everything you'll expect but remember it's Creekside

likes.liked: — Quality - from the ice-dispensing fridge to spa-bath, washer/dryer to 3 TVs and Hi-Fi within a HUGE apartment.
likes.disliked: — Lack of view ... but it was completely silent.

reviews.text: Other Lodge amenities were also excellent. Two huge outdoor hot tubs, one for adults, one for kids. A really nice outdoor heated pool. Big, well-equipped workout facilities. Large and very comfortable lobby.
reviews.title: No egg cups!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was good, the staff was friendly and responsive.
reviews.title: Fantastic place, amazing value

reviews.text: I also liked the Creekside location. Short walk (3 minutes or less) to everything you need -- grocery store, restaurants and bars, ski shop and ski rental, video store, internet cafe, Starbucks, etc.
reviews.title: Great Accommodations

reviews.text: I will stay here again in the winter for ski season without a doubt. I like the fact that it is a little ways from the noise of whistler village as my kids are young and still need the get to bed relatively early (9pm). We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit and having the den made nights fun playing games and watching movies. The unit was extremely clean and had "extras" like heated floors. You do have to check in at the Legends like others have pointed out which isn't a big deal. Parking is below the building which in the winter will be very useful.
reviews.title: Oustanding Place to Stay

reviews.text: We stayed at First Tracks on July 5 and we were impressed with the space, style and quality of our 2 bedroom unit. One bedroom had a king bed, the other a queen, and there was a sofa bed in the open kitchen/dining/living room area in the middle. Each bedroom had its own TV and bathroom. There was also a TV in the living room. A laundry room with storage racks is right by the entry. The bathrooms and kitchen are attractively decorated in granite and wood.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Creekside section

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a heated main pool and 2 hot tubs, one for adults only, and a workout room. Some guests used the Lodge's BBQ grill to cook their dinner by the pool. A Japanese restaurant is located in the Lodge, which is right next to the chairlift. (The chairlift was not running at this time.)
reviews.title: Wonderful
Not too bad for a "south of town" condo
reviews.text: The Creekside section was quiet compared to the main Whistler Village, which was a few miles further north. There are several restaurant choices in this area, but most of the restaurants are in the main village. You would need to drive back to the village or take the local bus.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a pleasant meal at Una Mas, the Mexican grill restaurant. We really liked the international, specialty and gourmet food choices at the Creekside Market grocery store.
reviews.title: First Tracks - Second Impressions

reviews.text: Thanks to all those who wrote a nice review of this place! It was just as described and, I think, one of the nicest lodgey (is that really a word?) properties that I have ever stayed at. Everything about the condo-type lodge room was 1st class - great kitchen with all the items you need to prepare most meals.
reviews.title: Can't think of a better place!

likes.liked: — The quality of the furnishings in the room were top notch!
likes.disliked: — Parking underground is a bit tight with a big SUV!

description: Located ski-in, ski-out at the base of Whistler Mountain in Whistler Creekside, First Tracks Lodge is an upscale, condo style hotel. This all suite hotel features suites ranging in size from one to four bedrooms. Each suite offers a full kitchen with upscale appliances and granite counter tops, a living area with a gas fireplace, private balconies and one full bathroom per bedroom. This property truly offers all of the comforts of home in a most convenient location. In addition, the Creekside Village is just steps away providing convenient access to a grocery store, liquor store, ski and board rentals, Whistler kids programs as well as a few coffee shops and eateries.
